question.questionA: Plants decumbent; leaves linear to narrowly ovate or lanceolate; fruit globular, muricate.
question.questionB: Plants procumbent; leaves broad, diamond-shaped; fruit pear-shaped not muricate.

question.questionA: Leaf tips often emarginate; fruit rugose.
question.questionB: Leaf tips pointed; fruit not rugose.

question.questionA: Terminal   inflorescence  long,  spicate,  interrupted  at  the base, basal branches long, few.
question.questionB: Terminal  inflorescence dense, uninterrupted  at  the base, basal  branches short, numerous.
